Package org.opensextant.giscore.geometry

Class Polygon

java.lang.Object
org.opensextant.giscore.geometry.Geometry
org.opensextant.giscore.geometry.GeometryBase
org.opensextant.giscore.geometry.Polygon
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Iterable<LinearRing>, IGISObject, VisitableGeometry, IDataSerializable
public class Polygon extends GeometryBase implements Iterable<LinearRing>
The Polygon class represents an ordered list of LinearRing objects for input and output in GIS formats such as ESRI Shapefiles or Google Earth KML files. A polygon begins with an outer ring, and is followed by zero or more inner rings to create holes in the Polygon. For direct compatibility with ESRI Shapefile Polygons, the points in the outer ring must be in clockwise order, and any inner rings must have their points in counter-clockwise order and be properly inside the outer ring (only vertex sharing is allowed, not segment intersection). This type of object does not exist as a primitive in input ESRI Shapefiles, since it is more restrictive than a ShapeType of Polygon (see MultiPolygons). However, it may be written as an ESRI Shapefile Polygon. In Google KML files, this object corresponds to a Geometry object of type Polygon.

Notes/restrictions:
- Polygon rings may have mixed dimensionality but such polygons will be downgraded to 2d.
- If validateTopology is selected then constructor enforces that the outer ring lists its points in the clockwise direction, and one or more fully and properly contained inner rings that list their points counter-clockwise.

Author:
Jason Mathews

  • Constructor Details

    • Polygon

      public Polygon()
      Empty ctor for object io. Constructor must be followed by call to readData() to initialize the object instance otherwise object is invalid.

    • Polygon

      public Polygon(LinearRing outerRing) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This Constructor takes an outer boundary ring and initializes a Geometry object for this Polygon object. By default, it does not do topology validation. To do validation, use alternate constructor.
      Parameters:
      outerRing - required outer boundary ring of polygon, never null
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if outerRing is null or not valid (i.e., LinearRing requires minimum of 4 points).

    • Polygon

      public Polygon(LinearRing outerRing, boolean validateTopology) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This Constructor takes an outer boundary ring and initializes a Geometry object for this Polygon object, performing validation checking if requested.
      Parameters:
      outerRing - required outer boundary ring of polygon, never null
      validateTopology - boolean flag indicating whether validation should be performed which will check that this Polygon Object has a single outer ring that lists its points in the clockwise direction, and one or more fully and properly contained inner rings that list their points counter-clockwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if outerRing is null or not valid.

    • Polygon

      public Polygon(LinearRing outerRing, List<LinearRing> innerRings) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This Constructor takes an outer boundary ring with a list of rings and initializes a Geometry object for this Polygon object. By default, it does not do topology validation. To do validation, use alternate constructor.
      Parameters:
      outerRing - required outer boundary ring of polygon, never null
      innerRings - List of Ring objects to use for the parts of this Polygon.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if object is not valid.

    • Polygon

      public Polygon(LinearRing outerRing, List<LinearRing> innerRings, boolean validateTopology) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This Constructor takes an outer boundary ring with a list of rings and initializes a Geometry Object for this Polygon object, performing validation checking if requested.
      Parameters:
      outerRing - required outer boundary ring of polygon, never null
      innerRings - List of inner ring objects to use for the parts of this Polygon.
      validateTopology - boolean flag indicating whether validation should be performed.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if object is not valid.

    • iterator

      @NotNull public @NotNull Iterator<LinearRing> iterator()
      This method returns an iterator for cycling through the inner rings in this Object. This class supports use of Java 'for each' syntax to cycle through the inner rings. The outer ring must be accessed via the getOuterRing() method.

      Returns:
      Iterator over LinearRing objects.

      The returned collection is unmodifiable.
      Returns:
      Collection of the LinearRing objects.
